elements.description:
`<url-detailed-editor>` Presents a form element that contains a list of
URL parameters.

The element can be validated as a regular form element.

### Example

```html
<url-detailed-editor url="{{url}}" invalid="{{invalid}}"></url-detailed-editor>
```

### Styling

`<url-input-editor>` provides the following custom properties and mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--url-input-editor` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`
`--url-input-editor-add-param-background-color` | Add param button background color | `#2196F3`
`--url-input-editor-add-param-color` | Add param button color | `#fff`
`--url-input-editor-query-title-color` | Color of the query parameters section title | `#737373`

properties.name: model
properties.description: Computed data model for the view.

properties.name: queryParameters
properties.description:
List of query parameters model.
If not set then it is computed from current URL.

Model for query parameters is:
- name {String} param name
- value {String} param value
- enabled {Boolean} is param included into the `value`

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description: A handler that is called on input

methods.name: _findSearchParam
methods.description: Finds a search parameter in a parser's model by given name.

methods.name: _findModelParam
methods.description: Searches for a query parameters model by given name.

methods.name: _modelChanged
methods.description: Updates the value when model changed.

methods.name: _updateParserValues
methods.description: Updates parser values from change record.

methods.name: _updateParserSearch
methods.description: Updates `queryParameters` model from change record.

methods.name: _onParamsRender
methods.description: Called when URL params form has been renederd.

methods.name: addSearchParam
methods.description: Adds a new Query Parameter to the list.

methods.name: _removeSearchParam
methods.description: Handler for the remove button click.

methods.name: _getValidity
methods.description: Validates the element.

return.desc: True if the form is valid.

methods.name: _encodeParameters
methods.description: Dispatches the `url-encode` event. The editor handles the action.

methods.name: _decodeParameters
methods.description: Dispatches the `url-decode` event. The editor handles the action.

elements.name: UiElements.UrlDetailedEditor

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: Computed data model for the view.

attributes.name: query-parameters
attributes.description:
List of query parameters model.
If not set then it is computed from current URL.

Model for query parameters is:
- name {String} param name
- value {String} param value
- enabled {Boolean} is param included into the `value`

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

events.name: url-decode
events.description:
Fired when decode URL action has been called.

The event does not bubbles.

events.name: url-encode
events.description:
Fired when encode URL action has been called.

The event does not bubbles.

elements.description:
The request URL editor

The editor renders a simple editor view with an input field. The input
uses `paper-autocomplete` element to render URL suggestions.

When setting `detailsOpened` property to `true` it renders detailed editor.
The editor allows to edit host, path, query parameetrs and hash
separatelly.

### Example

```html
<url-input-editor
 url="{{requestURL}}"
 on-send-request="_sendAction"
 on-url-value-changed="_handleNewUrl"></url-input-editor>
```

### Styling

`<url-input-editor>` provides the following custom properties and mixins
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--url-input-editor` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`

Use paper elements mixin to style this element.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: detailsOpened
properties.description: True if detailed editor is opened.

properties.name: defaultProtocol
properties.description: Default protocol for the URL if it's missing.

properties.name: suggesionsOpened
properties.description: True when a suggestion box for the URL is opened.

properties.name: colapseTransitioning
properties.description: Controlled by the collapse element flad used to animate detail panel.

properties.name: queryParameters
properties.description:
List of query parameters model.
It is passed to detailed editor to build query parameters form.
If not set then it is computed from current URL.

Model for query parameters is:
- name {String} param name
- value {String} param value
- enabled {Boolean} is param included into the `value`

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _onValueChanged
methods.description: A handler that is called on input

methods.name: _extValueChangedHandler
methods.description:
A handler for the `url-value-changed` event.
If this element is not the source of the event then it will update the `value` property.
It's to be used besides the Polymer's data binding system.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Opens detailed view.

methods.name: encodeParameters
methods.description: HTTP encode query parameters

methods.name: decodeParameters
methods.description: HTTP decode query parameters

methods.name: _dispatchAnalyticsEvent
methods.description: Dispatches analytics event with "event" type.

params.name: label
params.description: A label to use with GA event

methods.name: _decodeEncode
methods.description: HTTP encode or decode query parameters depending on [type].

methods.name: _processUrlParams
methods.description:
Processes query parameters and path value by `processFn`.
The function has to be available on this instance.

params.name: processFn
params.description: Function name to call on each parameter

methods.name: _detailsOpenedChanged
methods.description: Ensures the URL has protocol value when detailed editor closes.

methods.name: _autocompleteQuery
methods.description:
Handler for autocomplete element query event.
Dispatches `url-history-query` to query history model for data.

methods.name: _dispatchUrlQuery
methods.description: Dispatches `url-history-query` custom event.

methods.name: _ensureUrlHasProtocol
methods.description:
Ensures that the URL has a protocol.
The detault protocol is defined in `defaultProtocol` property.
The protocol is inserted into the URL value only if the value is not a
path and it's not a variable.

methods.name: _mainFocus
methods.description: Ensures that protocol is set before user input.

methods.name: _onEnter
methods.description:
A handler called when the user press "enter" in any of the form fields.
This will send a `send` event.

methods.name: encodeQueryString
methods.description:
Returns a string where all characters that are not valid for a URL component have been escaped. The escaping of a character is done by converting it into its UTF-8 encoding and then encoding each of the resulting bytes as a %xx hexadecimal escape sequence.

Note: this method will convert any the space character into its escape short form, '+' rather than %20. It should therefore only be used for query-string parts.

The following character sets are not escaped by this method:

  • ASCII digits or letters
  • ASCII punctuation characters: 
    - _ . ! ~ * ' ( )

Notice that this method does encode the URL component delimiter characters:

; / ? : & = + $ , #

params.name: str
params.description: A string containing invalid URL characters

return.desc: a string with all invalid URL characters escaped

methods.name: decodeQueryString
methods.description:
Returns a string where all URL component escape sequences have been
converted back to their original character representations.

Note: this method will convert the space character escape short form, '+',
into a space. It should therefore only be used for query-string parts.

params.name: str
params.description: string containing encoded URL component sequences

return.desc: string with no encoded URL component encoded sequences

methods.name: _colapseTransitioning
methods.description:
A trick to instantly replace main URL input with host field and back
without animation jumping when transitioning.
Sets / removes `sized` class name from the collapse element. This class
sets minimum height for the element so the host field will be visible
instantly in place of dissapearing main URL.

methods.name: _getValidity
methods.description: Validates the element.

methods.name: _computeToggleClass
methods.description: Computes class name for the toggle button

elements.name: UiElements.UrlInputEditor

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

attributes.name: details-opened
attributes.description: True if detailed editor is opened.

attributes.name: default-protocol
attributes.description: Default protocol for the URL if it's missing.

attributes.name: suggesions-opened
attributes.description: True when a suggestion box for the URL is opened.

attributes.name: colapse-transitioning
attributes.description: Controlled by the collapse element flad used to animate detail panel.

attributes.name: query-parameters
attributes.description:
List of query parameters model.
It is passed to detailed editor to build query parameters form.
If not set then it is computed from current URL.

Model for query parameters is:
- name {String} param name
- value {String} param value
- enabled {Boolean} is param included into the `value`

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

events.name: send-request
events.description: Fired when the user use the "entrer" key in any of the fields.

events.name: url-history-query
events.description:
Fired when autocomplete element request data.
This event is to be handled by `url-history-saver` element but it can be
handled by any element that intercepts this event.

events.name: url-value-changed
events.description:
Fired when the URL value change.
Note that this event is fired before validation occur and therefore
the URL may be invalid.
